COLUMBUS, Ohio (Statehouse News Bureau) — It’s up to House Speaker Bob Cupp (R-Lima) to call for a new Ohio Redistricting Commission meeting but at this point no one knows when or even if that meeting will happen.

There’s no word yet from Cupp on when the redistricting commission will meet to adopt new state House and Senate district maps, after their second attempt was again found unconstitutional by the supreme court.

The commission has yet to see a map that is both proportional and constitutional.
